title: What are the similarities between Nelson Mandela and Mahatma Gandhi? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not much. Other than the bottom line as mentioned by Leo Swart here, Gandhi (spelling different here) was a whole scale up. We was instrumental in hastening the decline of a large part of the former British Empire. I would go so far as to say he (and his peers) did more to change the world (not just South Asia) than Mandela. Mandela was more symbolic than an actual agent for change. Gandhi had more questionable personal habits.
They were not at all similar, Gandhi promoted peaceful change. Mandela promoted violence, This is what he was sent to prison for, He changed his mind about it all while he was inside.
